verses.verse: When Balaam <S%H1109><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that it pleased <S%H5869><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> to bless <S%H1288><s%> Israel, <S%H3478><s%> he didn't <S%H1980><s%> go, as at the other times, <S%H6471><s%> to meet <S%H7125><s%> with enchantments, <S%H5173><s%> but he set <S%H7896><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> toward the wilderness. <S%H4057><s%>

Balaam <S%H1109><s%> lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and he saw <S%H7200><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> dwelling <S%H7931><s%> according to their tribes; <S%H7626><s%> and the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God came on him. <S%H430><s%>

He took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Balaam <S%H1109><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Beor <S%H1160><s%> says, <S%H559><s%> the man <S%H1397><s%> whose eye <S%H5869><s%> was closed <S%H8365><s%> says; <S%H5002><s%>

he says, <S%H5002><s%> who hears <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of God, <S%H410><s%> who sees <S%H2372><s%> the vision <S%H4236><s%> of the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> falling <S%H5307><s%> down, <S%H5869><s%> and having his eyes open: <S%H1540><s%>
How goodly <S%H2895><s%> are your tents, <S%H168><s%> Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and your tents, <S%H4908><s%> Israel! <S%H3478><s%>

As valleys <S%H5158><s%> they are spread forth, <S%H5186><s%> as gardens <S%H1593><s%> by the riverside, <S%H5104><s%> as aloes <S%H174><s%> which Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> has planted, <S%H5193><s%> as cedar trees <S%H730><s%> beside the waters. <S%H4325><s%>

Water <S%H4325><s%> shall flow <S%H5140><s%> from <S%H5140><s%> his buckets. <S%H1805><s%> His seed <S%H2233><s%> shall be in many <S%H7227><s%> waters. <S%H4325><s%> His king <S%H4428><s%> shall be higher <S%H7311><s%> than Agag. <S%H90><s%> His kingdom <S%H4438><s%> shall be exalted. <S%H5375><s%>

God <S%H410><s%> brings him out <S%H3318><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%> He has as it were the strength <S%H8443><s%> of the wild ox. <S%H7214><s%> He shall eat up <S%H398><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> his adversaries, <S%H6862><s%> shall break <S%H1633><s%> their bones <S%H6106><s%> in pieces, <S%H4272><s%> and pierce them with his arrows. <S%H2671><s%>

He couched, <S%H3766><s%> he lay down <S%H7901><s%> as a lion, <S%H738><s%> as a lioness; <S%H3833><s%> who shall rouse him up? <S%H6965><s%> Everyone who blesses <S%H1288><s%> you is blessed. <S%H1288><s%> Everyone who curses you is cursed. <S%H779><s%>"

Balak <S%H1111><s%>'s anger <S%H639><s%> was kindled <S%H2734><s%> against Balaam, <S%H1109><s%> and he struck <S%H5606><s%> his hands <S%H3709><s%> together; <S%H5606><s%> and Balak <S%H1111><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Balaam, <S%H1109><s%> "I called <S%H7121><s%> you to curse <S%H6895><s%> my enemies, <S%H341><s%> and, <S%H1288><s%> behold, you have altogether blessed <S%H1288><s%> them these three <S%H7969><s%> times. <S%H6471><s%>

Therefore now flee <S%H1272><s%> you to your place! <S%H4725><s%> I thought <S%H559><s%> to promote <S%H3513><s%> you to great <S%H3513><s%> honor; <S%H3513><s%> but, <S%H3068><s%> behold, Yahweh has kept you back <S%H4513><s%> from honor. <S%H3519><s%>"
Balaam <S%H1109><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Balak, <S%H1111><s%> "Didn't <S%H1696><s%> I also tell your messengers <S%H4397><s%> who you sent <S%H7971><s%> to me, <S%H559><s%> saying,

<S%H1111><s%> 'If Balak would give <S%H5414><s%> me his house <S%H1004><s%> full <S%H4393><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold, <S%H2091><s%> I can't <S%H3201><s%> go beyond <S%H5674><s%> the word <S%H6310><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> either good <S%H2896><s%> or bad <S%H7451><s%> of my own mind. <S%H3820><s%> I will say <S%H1696><s%> what Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> says <S%H1696><s%>'?

Now, <S%H1980><s%> behold, I go to my people: <S%H5971><s%> come, <S%H3212><s%> I will inform <S%H3289><s%> you what this people <S%H5971><s%> shall do <S%H6213><s%> to your people <S%H5971><s%> in the latter <S%H319><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>"

He took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Balaam <S%H1109><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Beor <S%H1160><s%> says, <S%H559><s%> the man <S%H1397><s%> whose eye <S%H5869><s%> was closed <S%H8365><s%> says; <S%H5002><s%>

he says, <S%H5002><s%> who hears <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of God, <S%H410><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the Most High, <S%H5945><s%> and who sees <S%H2372><s%> the vision <S%H4236><s%> of the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> Falling <S%H5307><s%> down, <S%H5869><s%> and having his eyes open: <S%H1540><s%>

I see <S%H7200><s%> him, <S%H7200><s%> but not now. I see him, <S%H7138><s%> but not near. A star <S%H3556><s%> will come <S%H1869><s%> out of Jacob. <S%H3290><s%> A scepter <S%H7626><s%> will rise <S%H6965><s%> out of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and shall strike <S%H4272><s%> through the corners <S%H6285><s%> of Moab, <S%H4124><s%> and break down <S%H6979><s%> all the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Sheth. <S%H8352><s%>

Edom <S%H123><s%> shall be a possession. <S%H3424><s%> Seir, <S%H8165><s%> his enemies, <S%H341><s%> also shall be a possession, <S%H3424><s%> while Israel <S%H3478><s%> does <S%H6213><s%> valiantly. <S%H2428><s%>
Out of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> shall one have dominion, <S%H7287><s%> and shall destroy <S%H6><s%> the remnant <S%H8300><s%> from the city. <S%H5892><s%>"

He looked <S%H7200><s%> at Amalek, <S%H6002><s%> and took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Amalek <S%H6002><s%> was the first <S%H7225><s%> of the nations, <S%H1471><s%> But his latter <S%H319><s%> end shall come <S%H5703><s%> to destruction. <S%H8><s%>"

He looked <S%H7200><s%> at the Kenite, <S%H7017><s%> and took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Your dwelling <S%H4186><s%> place is strong. <S%H386><s%> Your nest <S%H7064><s%> is set <S%H7760><s%> in the rock. <S%H5553><s%>
Nevertheless Kain <S%H7014><s%> shall <S%H518><s%> be wasted, <S%H1197><s%> until Asshur <S%H804><s%> carries you away captive. <S%H7617><s%>"
He took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Alas, <S%H188><s%> who shall live <S%H2421><s%> when God <S%H410><s%> does this? <S%H7760><s%>

But ships <S%H6716><s%> shall come from the coast <S%H3027><s%> of Kittim. <S%H3794><s%> They shall afflict <S%H6031><s%> Asshur, <S%H804><s%> and shall afflict <S%H6031><s%> Eber. <S%H5677><s%> He also shall come <S%H5703><s%> to destruction. <S%H8><s%>"
Balaam <S%H1109><s%> rose up, <S%H6965><s%> and went <S%H3212><s%> and returned <S%H7725><s%> to his place; <S%H4725><s%> and Balak <S%H1111><s%> also went <S%H1980><s%> his way. <S%H1870><s%>
